Ken Olofsen tried to display a 9.86MB PDF attachment called "Atlassian EclipseCon 2009 Poster (FINAL).pdf" inside a view file macro. However, the contents won't display presumably due to its large size. Please this page on EAC to reproduce the bug.

http://extranet.atlassian.com/display/MAR/EclipseCon+2009+Poster+Submission

fields.summary: Viewfile macro with a word document throws java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: -10

fields.description:
The getPermissions and getPermissionsForUser methods return the list of space-level permissions for the current or specified user.

What we lack is the ability to see all the permissions for a given space.  In order to build a complete view, a developer would need to run the getPermissionsForUser method against all users on the site.  Ideally, they should simply be able to get the list of permissions (including group permissions) for the site.
fields.summary: Add a method to return the complete list of space permissions

fields.description:
I have an rss feed for jira and confluence extensions, since from time to time spam appears on your pages, i moved the pages to "to delete".
Now i have seen that in the rss feed it appears that i created the spam *see attachments*.
fields.summary: RSS feed displays "added" while it should be "edited"

See http://developer.atlassian.com/jira/browse/CONFATT-4 for some further discussion.

fields.description:
We need this documentation. 

This has been discussed by mail so far, but didn't get actioned yet. Please schedule for this week.

-----

Yes, that sounds all very reasonable, let's please do it like this. It can't take that long to write down a page for this, can it (asking Matt and Chris)? Even if we wouldn't use the hover for other products, we should still provide this kind of documentation even for "just" plugin developers, and for our future selves (e.g. if someone else on the team wants to reuse the hover in another context)

Cheers,
Per

> The implement guide should describe everything that a product needs to do to implement user hover, answering questions like:
>
> * What JavaScript code should I use to display the hover? * How should the server-side action display the hover information?
> * What web-items section should I use for links
> * What content should be in the main panel of the hover?
> * What content should be in the main buttons and how should it be determined?
>
> Yes, these are things that could be conveyed by having Charles sit down with the developer and walk through, but I've found a document, shared between teams, promotes consistency, simplifies interactions, and is a nice reference guide for estimation and planning.  Without things like this being spelled out, if it is possible for products to do things differently, they'll do it in ways you can't imagine.
>
> Don
>
> Adnan Chowdhury wrote:
>> Sorry, wrong Don.
>>
>> a
>>
>> On 16/03/2009, at 11:00 AM, Adnan Chowdhury wrote:
>>
>>> Hey guys,
>>>
>>> It was mentioned in the integration meeting that we should produce an 'implementation guide' for the user hover that other teams can use when they are implementing the user hover in their products. I don't know what that is, or what should be in it, but I think you two should get together to work out what's required and whether only Charles is required or someone else to write it.
>>>
>>> @Don: do you have an example in mind for what's required? Or should this be worked out in a meeting?
>>>
>>> a
>>>
>>
>
fields.summary: No developer documentation for user hover popup

fields.description:
I had a Word document with resized images throughout the entire document, however displaying it in Confluence with the Office Connector resulted in the images rendering in full size.

It would be great if the Office Connector detected image widths and preserved them (at say an equivalent size to when viewing a Word Document in Word @ 100% view size) with the ability to click to get the full sized image.
fields.summary: Office Connector for Word does not preserve image width contraints

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-14965].
  {panel}

The following methods in the remote API return the permissions specific to the page:

getContentPermissionSets
getContentPermissionSet
getPagePermissions

However, since view permissions are inheritable, this is an incomplete view.  Currently, to assemble the permissions, a developer writing code against our API would have to work their way up the tree and overlay any view permissions encountered along the way.

It would be more useful to be able to get the effective permissions on a page, either through one of the existing methods or a new method.
fields.summary: Return inherited view permissions in remote API calls

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-14964].
  {panel}

The recently-updated macro can be used to show a list of content, along with the date it was last updated.

The date shown is in the form <day><month>.  The year is not shown.

When the macro is displaying 'recent' content, there is no problem as the year can be assumed to be the current one.

However, there are cases where the macro can be used to show content from a long time ago, and in these cases the display is confusing. The user has to click through to the page itself to find out the correct year. 

It would be better if the displayed dates contained the year if it was not the current one.
fields.summary: Recently Updated macro should show the year that the update occured if not the current one

fields.description:
Use markup {code}{recently-updated:max=1000}{code}

In 2.10, this will return 1000 results of the most recently updated content - as the limit is so large this will include content updated fairly long ago (Aug 31, 2008 on QA-CAC).

In 3.0, the results are not limited by the 'max' parameter, but seem to be returned from only within a certain time period (since March 04, 2009) on my local instance.

This behaviour should not have changed, unless we are also adding a parameter to control how recent the content should be.
fields.summary: Recently Updated macro results are limited to within an arbitrary time period
Recently Updated macro does not allow filtering by content type of profile

fields.description:
Edit a page with user1.
Edit the same page with user2.

The recently-updated macro will then show two entries for this page - one for each edit.

This seems counter-intuitive. If a page has been updated recently, it should only be shown once, regardless of how many edits it has been through. Otherwise, the macro risks simply showing several edits of a single popular page, at the expense of showing other updated content.

Also, if the same user edits the page twice, then it will only be shown once. 

This is also different from the behaviour of the macro in 2.10.
fields.summary: Recently Updated macro will display the same page multiple times when edited by different users

fields.description:
When a status is updated, the recently-updated macro will show both the old and the new statuses.

It should only show the new status.  The old one is old, and has not been 'updated' from the users' persepective.
fields.summary: Recently Updated macro shows both old and new statuses when they are updated

fields.description: The usage tracking plugin scales badly. We should warn the admin about this in the Admin page warning. Please see Giles for the appropriate text.
fields.summary: Admin page warning message about the non-scalability of the Usage Tracking Plugin
More control over mail archiving with attachments

fields.description:
JIRA has a good discussion on which JDBC driver is compatible to what Oracle database: http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v3.13/databases/oracle.html

It is important for Confluence customers if we have the same information copied across to these documentation:
- http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Known+Issues+For+Oracle
- http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Database+Setup+for+Oracle
fields.summary: Extract information about Oracle JDBC driver from JIRA's documentation to Confluence's

Ajay suggested I raise this against the produce for want of a more appropriate place.  If there's a better place for this to go, please put it there.

fields.description:
It seems like the new version of the JiraIssues macro in version 2.10 doesn't correctly render the table of issues. Even though the table itself takes the width of its surrounding element (eg. a table with a defined width), the vertical space it occupies is as wide as the sum of the width of all the columns. 

We have temporarily fixed the issue by adding the renderMode=static.

See attachmement for a screen snapshot of the issue, with some additional information.
fields.summary: The new version of the JiraIssues macro in version 2.10 has some rendering issues

fields.description:
The powerpoint attached to https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-29982 is causing an OutOfMemoryException because the open source library that we use to render PICT files is blowing up on one of the embedded PICT files. 

PICT files are Macintosh metafiles that serialize Mac graphic function calls. Generally these get embedded when you copy and paste the image from the clipboard. A workaround would be to directly embed a different type of image by using Office instead of the clipboard.
fields.summary: viewfile causing OutOfMemoryError for Powerpoint files that contain embedded PICT file (Mac OS X)

fields.description:
http://developer.atlassian.com/jira/browse/TASK-127

There is a javascript in Confluence that calls {{placeFocus()}} on page load. That script will inevitable search the whole page and focus the first text field that is visible and not disabled. 

This will cause the page to auto scroll down to where the tasklist's text field is on page load. There is no good way currently in the JavaScript to bypass the autofocus.
fields.summary: Confluence's Javascript Autofocus on First Text Field Onpage Load

fields.description:
A user downloaded a wiki page via the Firefox extension DownThemAll!, https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/201

This triggered deletion of all page attachments. No record of this deletion was made in page history. It was only via the apache log that it was identified via requests of the form:

GET /confluence/pages/removeattachment.action?pageId=

The ability to delete content via GET violates RFC2616 (section 9.1.1):

"In particular, the convention has been established that the GET and HEAD methods SHOULD NOT have the significance of taking an action other than retrieval."
fields.summary: Attachments can be deleted via GET requests

fields.description: Matrices and spreadsheets are really useful for organizing product requirements. Currently, tables in Confluence are really rudimentary and hard to work with. Users should be able to create tables in Confluence that render more like the Issue Navigator in Jira (with sortable columns). Javascript libraries like EXT, Dojo and jquery have widgets that do this.
fields.summary: add tables with sortable columns
com.sun.pdfview.font.Type1CFont.readCommand(Type1CFont.java:357) consumes 100% CPU, blocks all other pdf threads

fields.description: During integration testing, I get a NPE similar to CONF-13551(see attached output.log). From a deployed plugin in Confluence 2.10.1, this NPE doesn't arise. Is my integration test incorrect (see attached code) or is this fixed in 2.10.1?
fields.summary: NullPointerException in WebResourceManager during plugin integration test
Viewfile macro rendering bug blanks out bottom half of some PDF pages

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-14917].
  {panel}

I did a large "cleanup" of a wiki site where I identified lots of pages having no or trivial content. These page were to be deleted. 

Some of these pages however had important attachments, but this fact is not easily visible. You see it only if you use the drop-down menu. In earlier Confluence releases there was a list of attachments displayed at the bottom of the page so it was more obvious at that time.

It would be nice if the standard warning, which is shown on deleting a page ("Are you sure you want to send this page to the trash?"), includes something like "This page contains n attachments". This would help the user avoiding deleting important attachments which are stored on seemingly dispensable pages.

The amount of work to implement this one extra status line is probably trivial but it would add a significant value to the product.
fields.summary: On delete page warn if page has attachments
Verbose logging: LuceneSearcherImpl:search - Error encounterd in lucene search: maxClauseCount is set to 1024

fields.description:
Based on the log files, I know that there were some requests that resulted in an exception, yet the JMX console shows that there were 0 errors.

It seems that the counter is not incremented when an error occurs.
fields.summary: RequestMetrics - ErrorCount doesn't capture errors
Expose 90th % of the Request Execution Time via the RequestMetrics MBean

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-14912].
  {panel}

Confluence already has some interesting MBeans, but one that I miss a lot is an MBean that would allow us to monitor the cache.

Here is what I'd like:

h5. Iteration 1:
make it possible to retrieve cache stats that are available via the Advanced Cache Statistics view via an MBean

h5. Iteration 2:
make it possible to _non-persistently_ change cache stats on the fly via an MBean

h5. Iteration 3:
make it possible to change _persistently_ change cache stats either via an MBean or via admin interface ([CONF-12836|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-12836])

(Given that optimal cache settings are critical for Confluence performance, I'm setting the priority to Major)
fields.summary: Add Cache JMX Support
Custom HTML banner causes Quick Navigation search window to cover input field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-14910].
  {panel}

We would like to able to search for exact text, and not have Lucene tokenise, remove stop words, or do any stemming.

We partly use Confluence as a knowledge base for our own software product, which includes lots of system codes, acrnoyms etc. The specific use case that prompted this was a user wanting to search for the text "S/D". Lucene strips off the 'S', and the '/', leaving the search to just look for 'd'. Not particularly useful.

It would be brilliant if we could enter a query somehow that overrode this. 

Raised following support issue CSP-29584
fields.summary: Provide ability to override Lucene tokenisation and stemming and search for exact text (literal search)
Create a function that prevents Confluence from loading installed plugins upon startup.

fields.description:
Remove the ability to expand/collapse
1. Individual comments
2. All comments (Collapse All/Expand All)
fields.summary: Remove all abilities to expand/collapse comments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-14888].
  {panel}

From [Tom Wolff's post|http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?threadID=32620&tstart=0] on the Confluence forum:

{quote}
One of the most powerful aspects of Confluence is its email notification of new and changed content. I'm sure this matter has been discussed previously, but I didn't find readily a forum posting that summarizes the issues as my wiki users and I see them.

The problem is that users receive too many email notifications that most people consider unhelpful at best and very annoying at worst. The control mechanisms currently available in Confluence 2.10 are inadequate to control sending email notifications, and "watch" options available to users can not make up for this deficiency.

I think we can divide actions and content into new, edited and removed pages, comments, news, and attachments as summarized below:

Content Type 	New 	Edited 	Removed
Page 	- 	X 	-
Comment 	- 	- 	-
News 	- 	- 	-
Attachment 	- 	- 	-


The X shows the only option, as far as I can tell, for preventing sending email notifications.

Per this chart, email notifications are automatically sent out for all combinations EXCEPT for edited pages based on whether users check the "Minor Change?" option box. (Searching the Confluence forum for "minor change" provides several conversations on this matter back at least to 2006.)

We find particularly annoying email notifications resulting from removing content. As administrator, I have removed pages, comments, and attachments as inappropriate or obsolete and have almost certainly not wanted to bring attention to that removed content.

We also believe email notifications about attachments (added, moved, or removed) to be of very low value. Attachments are almost always supporting or described by the page content itself which will be the subject of its own email notification.

My users and I believe it is past time for Atlassian to provide users and administrators better control in Confluence over sending these email notifications. This includes, but is not limited to, improving the "Minor Change?" option with clear option buttons or similar mechanisms as discussed in other forum entries.

I look forward to elaboration of this issue by other users and action by Atlassian on this matter. 
{quote}
fields.summary: Better control of email notifications for new, changed, and removed content

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-14887].
  {panel}

Attachments to pages are not attached to notifications from Confluence.  This means any embedded images in the page cannot be seen from offline email clients.

The "Email Page" feature, which ships with Confluence as a disabled bundled plugin, also does not send page attachments with the email.  The UI does not mention this.  Ideally it would allow users to choose which attachments are sent.

From [Mark DeSimone's post|http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?threadID=32629&tstart=0] on the Confluence Forum:

We have a lot of users who travel and do work offline. So, they need to have the wiki pages and any relevant attachments in an email so when they get on the plane or train, they can work on the issue. The problem we are having is:

When a page is emailed, either from a watch or emailing it from tools, we need to have it include attachments

Are there any solutions? If not, what are some ways around it? Right now I am having trouble with adoption because everyone still likes to use Office documents and email, even if it gets a little crazy.
fields.summary: Include a page's attachments in email notifications or when emailing a page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-14886].
  {panel}

I like how it works in JIRA - I can see number of users in each user group.
See JIRA screenshot.

Would be very good to have similar functionality in Confluence.
Now I have to open group by group to see how many users are assigned to the group.
fields.summary: Show number of users in user group

fields.description:
Given the following:
-http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+Cookies, which says "a one-way hash of the user's password" is stored in a browser cookie on the user's computer.
-CSP-29692 (case I opened with Atlassian support), which explained that EncryptionUtils.java is used to encrypt the password.
-EncryptionUtils.java, which suggests the password is encrypted using PBEWithMD5AndDES (http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.5.0/docs/guide/security/jce/JCERefGuide.html#AppA)

Confluence unnecessarily stores a user's password on the client machine, and it does so with questionable security.

First, there is never a reason to store a user's password, or hash thereof, on a client machine. Ever. You should be using some other token whose generation algorithm does not even use the password as an input.

Second, even if you can rebut #1, what you store is utterly useless to LDAP-connected Confluence installs. You can only authenticate to a directory server with the original password. A 1 way hash of the password has no value with LDAP authentication, so you're creating risk with no benefit.

Third, your use of MD5+DES is questionable. DES does not provide acceptable security to the US federal government, and MD5 has significant vulnerabilities. Even the PKCS #5 1.5 standard upon which PBEWithMD5AndDES is based was superseded in 1999. See http://www.rsa.com/rsalabs/node.asp?id=2127.
fields.summary: Vulnerable and pointless password storage on client computers

fields.description: I recently added my site to http://wiki.list.org/display/COM/Organizations+that+use+Mailman and as you can see, the ü in the domain name gives strange results.  Since beginning of 2008, non-ASCII characters are allowed in URLs.
fields.summary: non-ASCII not supported in links

fields.description:
When copying a page to a different space than the original, the page title must be changed. The error msg refers to the originating space when stating "A page with this title already exists".

You have to select the new space, save the page with a different title, then edit and change the title to the desired one. Frustrating!

The validation should check the destination space, rather than the originating space, for the existance of a page with the same title.
fields.summary: Cannot copy a page between spaces and maintain the same title, even though the page title is not being used in the new space

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-14882].
  {panel}

Improve the page "Remove" functionality:

Currently the process to remove pages is labourious, particularly when having to remove multiple pages. I can appreciate not wanting to promote the removal of pages, but it is a necessary evil, and should be easier to do. My suggestions are:

1) Prompt to also remove or relocate child pages when deleting a parent. This would be a big improvement on its own.
2) Have a checkbox somewhere on the "Browse Pages" section to allow removing multiple pages in one action. Currently we have to navigate to a page, click "remove", confirm, we're redirected to the space homepage..... Rinse and repeat for multiple deletions :-(
3) Make the process an ajax enabled one, thereby minimising the time spent doing so
4) somewhere on the "Browse Pages" allow us to drag and drop pages onto a trsh can icon
fields.summary: Improve page removal functionality

fields.description:
Both groups (of the same name) will appear in the group browser; representing the LDAP and local group respectively. However, joining a user to the local group will yield a stack trace. The issue is also reproducible when you add a local user to an LDAP group (a group with different name from local group)
\\ 

{code}
2009-03-12 13:52:19,171 ERROR [http-8210-5] [atlassian.confluence.servlet.ConfluenceServletDispatcher] sendError Could not execute action
 -- referer: http://localhost:8210/admin/users/editusergroups-start.action?username=jane.doe | url: /admin/users/editusergroups.action | userName: admin
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException: Cannot write to read-only GroupManager [ldapRepository]
	at com.atlassian.user.impl.ReadOnlyGroupManager.addMembership(ReadOnlyGroupManager.java:35)
	at com.atlassian.user.impl.cache.CachingGroupManager.addMembership(CachingGroupManager.java:156)
	at com.atlassian.user.impl.delegation.DelegatingGroupManager.addMembership(DelegatingGroupManager.java:231)
	at bucket.user.DefaultUserAccessor.addMembership(DefaultUserAccessor.java:505)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.user.DefaultUserAccessor.addMembership(DefaultUserAccessor.java:73)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:585)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:304)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.invokeJoinpoint(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:182)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:149)

{code}

A workaround is to remove either the local or LDAP group. As for adding a user to an LDAP group, this should be done in the LDAP server rather than in Confluence.
fields.summary: Unable to add user to LDAP group

fields.description: The user's expectation is to see in print what they see on screen. The inconsistency is jarring. Have spoken to Design (stephen) who feels the same.
fields.summary: Print stylesheet body type should have sans serif typeface like new PDF Export and the page itself

fields.description:
I have a plugin with  velocity file that contains this call:

{code}
    #showPermissions( ["g"] $action "false")
{code}

this throws an ParseErrorException:

2009-03-12 12:52:35,109 ERROR [http-1990-Processor19] [atlassian.confluence.servlet.ConfluenceServletDispatcher] sendError Could not execute action
 -- url: /wiki/admin/permissions/defaultspacepermissions.action | userName: testadmin | referer: http://localhost:1990/wiki/admin/classpath.action
org.apache.velocity.exception.ParseErrorException: Encountered "]" at line 6, column 45 of /com/atlassian/studio/confluence/globaladmin/defaultspacepermissions.vm
Was expecting one of:
    <RPAREN> ...
    <WHITESPACE> ...
    "," ...
    <IDENTIFIER> ...
    "{" ...
    <WORD> ...
    <STRING_LITERAL> ...
    <INTEGER_LITERAL> ...
    "[" ...
    <FLOATING_POINT_LITERAL> ...
    "{" ...
    "true" ...
    "false" ...
    
	at org.apache.velocity.Template.process(Template.java:137)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.util.velocity.ConfigurableResourceManager.loadResource(ConfigurableResourceManager.java:363)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.util.velocity.ConfigurableResourceManager.getResource(ConfigurableResourceManager.java:304)
	at org.apache.velocity.runtime.RuntimeInstance.getTemplate(RuntimeInstance.java:1102)


The  workaround is to change velocity code to:

{code}
#set($a =  ["g"])
#showPermissions($a $action "false")
{code}
fields.summary: Velocity13TemplateConverter produces syntax error on velocity files

fields.description:
Could one of the Confluence developers please compile a list of all the links from the Confluence application into the documentation pages on CAC (i.e. into the DOC space).

This would need to include all links from:
* the Confluence application UI
* the Setup Wizard 
* the Notation Guide
* Help tips
* Anywhere else?

The list will be used for the following purposes:
* We need to tidy up the Confluence documentation space (DOC), by removing a lot of outdated pages. So we need to know which pages are referenced explicitly from outside CAC.
* For Confluence 3, we are thinking of enhancing the online help in Confluence. So we need to see exactly what's happening now, before we start improving it.
fields.summary: Please compile a list of all the links from the Confluence 3.0 application itself into the documentation pages on CAC

fields.description: Implement a link browser as per Spec: https://extranet.atlassian.com/jira/browse/UI-586 and design: https://extranet.atlassian.com/jira/browse/UI-585
fields.summary: Link Browser
Lite Media Browser

fields.description: Adding people to my favourites from my favourite page (http://extranet.atlassian.com/users/viewfavouritepeople.action?username=sleberrigaud) is easy and obvious. However it is not obvious to remove them. I didn't know at first that I had to use the user hover.
fields.summary: Make removing my favourite people easier

fields.description:
No need for this as it has been replaced, and it is skewing the search results.

    http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/(outdated)+Keyboard+Shortcuts

Can we please remove?

Nick
fields.summary: Remove outdated doco

fields.description:
The tread dump tool is great, but if customers have a slow-running system, they might just go for "raise support request" and not have any of the threaddumps in the logfiles, which causes a roundtrip to our support team.

One option would be to prompt the confluence admin in the raise-support-request-action to take threaddumps into the logfiles, so they get bundled in the support request. We should also provide a link to the threaddump tool.

If there are better ways of getting this information: fine with me too
fields.summary: Ensure new thread dump plugin value is brought to support-request-action

fields.description:
Hi, 
using Confluence 2.10.2 with full LDAP user management and clicking on my user "profile" 
-> the profile summary says: "Read Only Account"
-> the user cannot edit his user profile, the "Edit profile" link / tab does not appear.
-> all user accounts configured in LDAP are affected

I saw other users with this issue and no resolution posted
fields.summary: User Profiles not Editable under LDAP integration

fields.description:
As documented in CONF-12126, at our knowledge base [CONFKB181536872|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Poor+Performance+due+to+LDAP+Cache+with+Incorrect+Key] as well as some of the docs like http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+multiple+LDAP+repositories, the ldap key name does not map to the ldap cache name if the key is changed from the default.

Confluence should map automatically the proper LDAP cache, or at least throw a warning in the UI (the Admin console?) that the cache mapping is incorrect.
fields.summary: LDAP Key should map automatically to ldap cache name

fields.description:
Very often we have to click Refresh button in browser to get rid of HTML Code.
See screenshot attached.

Very annoying.
fields.summary: Confluence returns HTML Code instead of rendered content
Blog-posts with excerpts do not respect column macro
Confluence administrator should be notified when setting the Attachment Maximum Size lower than the existing attachments
IllegalTransactionStateException due to trying to rollback a transaction that has already been rolled back.

fields.description:
Whilst attempting to reproduce CONF-14807 under 2.10 on QA-CAC, an {{org.apache.velocity.exception.MethodInvocationException}} from a {{java.lang.IllegalStateException}} was thrown; which did not occur on QA-EAC (3.0-m6 at time of writing), when the related issue was filed.

h5.Cause

{noformat}
org.apache.velocity.exception.MethodInvocationException: Invocation of method 'getPage' in class com.atlassian.confluence.user.UsernameToUserTranslatingPaginationSupport threw exception java.lang.IllegalStateException: Trying to call getPage() when items has not been initialised in PaginationSupport @ /admin/users/browsegroupmembers.vm[56,36]
    at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTIdentifier.execute(ASTIdentifier.java:205)

caused by: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Trying to call getPage() when items has not been initialised in PaginationSupport
    at bucket.core.actions.PaginationSupport.getPage(PaginationSupport.java:205
{noformat}

The full HTML of the Oops is attached as [^Oops an error has occurred.html]
fields.summary: Attempting to add a member to a group with RFC3986 Reserved Characters in the group name causes o.a.v.e.MIE from j.l.ISE

fields.description:
# Add a page, and enter text
# Make sure the draft is saved for this page, and navigate away
# Add a page - there will be a message asking if you want to resume editing the draft
# Enter a space into the wiki markup tab
# Click on 'resume editing' link

Expected behaviour - you are able to continue editing the previously saved draft

Actual behaviour - the new page content is now saved as the draft content, which overwrites the previously saved draft content. You are now editing an empty page, and all of the text entered previously has been lost.
fields.summary: Draft pages can easily be lost by making a change in the markup tab before saving

fields.description:
When I remove a draft my address bar changes to the following : http://extranet.atlassian.com/users/viewmydrafts.action?discardDraftId=701694405

If that page is reloaded (for instance, returning to an earlier session in Firefox), I receive the following error:

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Content entity object should not be null
    at org.springframework.util.Assert.notNull(Assert.java:112) 

Along with a long stack trace. 

It should behave better than this, and simply take me back to the Drafts page.
fields.summary: Discarding a draft and refreshing the page results in an error
Detect VMWare and display warning in Administration Console
Add XMPP hyperlink support
Indicate to user when Rich Text Editor is not supported

fields.description:

Links to other pages will also overflow into the next field

Switching editor causes curly bracket being deleted in {*}
Add pagination to Confluence User Guide

fields.description:
The java.policy listed on [Java Policy Security|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Java+Policy+Security+with+Confluence] does not allow for OSGi plugins used in Confluence 2.10.x, meaning the policy is incompatible with 2.10.x or higher.

Can we please update the documentation to reflect this?
fields.summary: Update Java Policy Security page for 2.10.x

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-14838].
  {panel}

Confluence still uses an uninstalled theme's layout (eg. the font will still be the old plugin's font) as its site layout although the plugin has been uninstalled.

Steps to replicate:
# Install a theme plugin
# Set the theme as the Site Theme
# Uninstall the theme
# Confluence theme selection page (http://ConfluenceURL/admin/choosetheme.action) will report that the site is using the default theme. Warnings will be populating the log file:
{noformat}
2009-03-10 16:11:26,659 WARN [http-8080-3] [atlassian.confluence.themes.DefaultThemeManager] extractTheme Unable to find configured theme module: com.atlassian.confluence.themes.classic:classic
 -- referer: http://localhost:8080/admin/console.action | url: /admin/choosetheme.action | userName: admin
{noformat}

Customers who used the Classic Theme as a site layout might encounter this warning after they have upgraded to Confluence 2.10.

The work around is to set Confluence site theme to other installed theme.
fields.summary: Themes from plugins is still referenced by Confluence after plugin is uninstalled
create a way to link to email attachments directly

fields.description:
The difference between watching a page, and not watching a page, is only a slight change in the hue of the message icon. 

Could I suggest that when a page is watched, the text on the pulldown menu changes to "Stop Watching", or "Unwatch" similar to the way JIRA does it.
fields.summary: Watch page feature is not friendly to color blind people
Expand macro does not support several nested elements

fields.description:
The restore of space backup from 2.9 to 2.10 doesn't work.
How to backup spaces before upgrading confluence to 2.9 to 2.10?
fields.summary: restoring space backup from confluence 2.9 to 2.10

fields.description:
When viewing the gallery macro from opera browsers the picture is rendered at the bottom of the whole page not over the current view.

To reproduce the problem:
Start Opera 9.50 (doubt that version matters)
Open http://wikis.sun.com/display/gridengine62u2/Express+Installation page
Click on series of 4 pictures (gallery macro)
=> You don't get the picture just the black effect. Picture is actually
rendered, but after the end of screen. One has to scroll down to the end of the
document!
fields.summary: Gallery macro rendered incorrectly on Opera browsers

fields.description: If a plugin couldn't be started during the DefaultPluginManagers init() phase, we try to disable it (com.atlassian.plugin.DefaultPluginManager.addPlugins(PluginLoader, Collection<Plugin>)). For a TriggerModuleDescriptor this will cause a call to com.atlassian.confluence.plugin.descriptor.TriggerModuleDescriptor.disabled(), which then tries to get the corresponding module from a JobModuleDescriptor of that plugin which might not be loaded at that time, causing an ISE at com.atlassian.confluence.plugin.module.PluginModuleHolder.getModule().
fields.summary: Plugin which fail to start during startup might cause an IllegalStateException

fields.description:
Today I lost some work in Confluence due to a bug.

I would have been able to restore my work had there been an ability to access versions of a Draft (rather than a page). Currently drafts are only saved as the most recent saved draft version. 

The bug I encountered restored the original page that I was working on, making the draft of the page revert back to the old page version. 

As I was editing the page for over an hour, being able to access a version of the page saved every 2-5 minutes, and then select the appropriate version would have been very helpful. Keeping this information for the current draft and most recent saved page version would have allowed a way out of this problem, which was introduced by unexpected behaviour/bugs.
fields.summary: Provide access to all versions of a current draft, over time or at each save point

fields.description:
Ask for confirmation when leaving or navigating away (via closing window or triggering back button) from unsaved edit.

I encountered a use case when the previously resolved issue CONF-5019 doesn't help. 

I was trying to go to back a few words with my cursor, and I accidentally pressed Apple rather than Option. As I had previously edited and saved the page earlier, then edited it again, hitting the back button twice, took me to the edit screen of the older version. Then moving the browser forwards again to resume editing my current version, triggered the function added in CONF-5019, saving the old version over the new version. 
 
The only solution I could see to avoid unplanned behaviour like this, is prompting the user if they want to save their work, like any other application (Word for example) does, if you are leaving the page or closing the page.

Example of how somone would accidentally go Back in their browser on OS X in Firefox: Apple-Left goes to the start of the line in MS Word & even in JIRA, but when editing in Confluence it commands the browser to go back to the previous page.
fields.summary: Ask for confirmation when leaving or navigating away (via closing window or triggering back button) from unsaved edit

fields.description:
If the plugins appear disabled after you start Confluence, you can [turn on INFO logging via log4j.properties|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+Logging] on the org.springframework.osgi package to get more information the next time you restart.

The following line appears in the logs at start-up indicating the problem:

bq.     2009-02-17 20:28:34,389 INFO [SpringOsgiExtenderThread-1] [internal.dependencies.startup.DependencyServiceManager] findServiceDependencies OsgiBundleXmlApplicationContext(bundle=confluence.extra.dynamictasklist2, config=osgibundle:/META-INF/spring/*.xml) is waiting for unsatisfied dependencies [[&webMenuManager, &httpRetrievalService, &johnsonEventContainer, &contentTypesDisplayMapper, &encryptionProvider, &indexTaskFactory, &tokenAuthenticationManager, &userMacroLibrary, &iconManager]]

*Patch available*

The are two versions of the patch:

- one for Confluence 2.10.1: [^configPatch.zip]
- one for Confluence 2.10.2: [^CONF-14823-2.10.2.patch.zip]

_It will break other versions of Confluence very badly!_

*To install it:*

- shut down Confluence
- extract the files from the patch matching your version of Confluence to {{confluence/WEB-INF/classes/}}. (The files in the services/ directory inside the zip file must go into {{confluence/WEB-INF/classes/services/}}.)
- start Confluence again.

When you restart Confluence with the same logging enabled, you should not see the line above (search for "webMenuManager") in the logs. Enabling the plugins via Administration > Plugin Manager should now work.
fields.summary: Dynamic tasklist, widget macros and plugin repository don't work after upgrade to Confluence 2.10.1 or 2.10.2
Inherited page permissions are not wrapped correctly in UI
